About Resume Works Gallery

For my first project in my Year 10 Digital Science course, I was asked to create a website with the following requirements:


  • A landing page with a navigation bar in the middle of the screen.
  • An "About Me" page which would cover information about me, where I was born, my family and pets.
  • A "Hobbies" page, which would cover the things I love to do.
  • A "My Future" page, which would discuss where I want to live and what I want to be doing when I am 30.


The landing page of my website was simple yet effective, featuring only a navigation bar in the middle of the screen. This allowed visitors to quickly and easily navigate to each of the other pages, where they could learn more about me.

The "About Me" page was a comprehensive look into my life, covering my background, family, pets, and values. I shared photos, stories, and personal reflections, providing a deeper understanding of who I am and what has shaped me.

The "Hobbies" page was all about the things I love to do in my free time and why they are important to me. I wrote about my passions, interests, and how they shape my personality.

The "My Future" page was a brief overview of my aspirations for the future. I shared my general ideas about where I would like to live and what I hope to be doing when I turn 30, without going into too much detail.

I am proud of the final product of this project. It was a great experience to learn about website design and development, and I am pleased with the outcome. The website accurately reflects who I am and what matters most to me, and I am confident that anyone visiting it will gain a deeper understanding of my life, my passions, and my aspirations.
